questions.question: What is the shortest distance in kilometres between San Francisco (38N 123W) and Dubai (25N 057E)?
A great circle has a northern vertex of 50N 100W. the southern vertex is:
An ICAO nautical mile is defined as:
How much is the polar diameter of the Earth different from the equatorial diameter?
The maximum difference between geodetic and geocentric latitude occurs at about?
Required course 045°(T), W/V=190°(T)/30, FL=55 @ ISA, Variation =15°E. CAS=120 knots. What is magnetic heading and G/S?
What is the shortest distance in kilometres between Cairo (30°17'N 030°10'E) and Durban (29°48'S 030°10'E)?
An aircraft at latitude 02°20'N tracks 180°(T) for 685 km. What is its latitude at the end of the flight?
An aircraft is at latitude 10N and is flying south at 444 km/hour. After 3 hours the latitude is:
The circumference of the Earth is approximately?
SAT=+35°C. Pressure alt (corrected for barometric error) =5000 feet. What is true alt?

Given that the value of ellipticity of the Earth is 1/297 and that the semi-major axis of the Earth, measured at the axis of the Equator is 6378.4 km, what is the semi-major axis of the Earth measured at the axis of the Poles?
You plan to fly a track (course) of 348°(T), Drift is 17°port, Variation is 32°W. Deviation is 4°E. What compass heading should you fly?
At a specific location, the value of magnetic variation:
options: depends on the value of magnetic heading
depends on the value of true heading
depends on the type of compass installed

questions.question: At the magnetic equator:
options: the isogonal is an agonic line

questions.question: The value of magnetic variation on a chart changes with time. This is due to:
options: movement of the magnetic poles, causing an increase
increase in the magnetic field, causing an increase
reduction in the magnetic field, causing a decrease
movement of the magnetic poles, which can cause either an increase or a decrease
questions.solution: movement of the magnetic poles, which can cause either an increase or a decrease

questions.question: One purpose of a compass calibration is to reduce the difference, if any, between:
options: Compass North and the lubber line

questions.question: Given: True Track 352°(T) Variation 11°W Deviation = -5° Drift 10°R What is heading °(C)?
Pressure altitude is 27 000 feet, OAT=-35°C, Mach No.=0.45, W/V=270/85 Track =200°(T). What is drift and ground speed?
You plan to take off from Khamis Mushayt, Saudi Arabia, elevation 6500 ft. The ambient temperature is +25°C. What is your density altitude?
You are flying at 400 kt TAS, Indicated temperature -50°C What is your COAT?
You are flying at FL330 at Mach No. 0.9. Ambient temperature is ISA+15. What is your TAS?
You plan to land on R/W 14. The met forecast wind velocity is 110/30. Variation is 30°W. What crosswind do you expect?
Given: IAS 120 knots, FL80, OAT+20°C. What is the TAS?
Given: TAS 200 kt, Track 110°(T), W/V 015/40, calculate heading (°T) and ground speed.
Given: True Hdg 145°, TAS 240 kt, True Track 150° G/S 210 kt, calculate the W/V.
Given: TAS 140 kt, heading 005°(T), W/V 265/25, calculate the drift and ground speed.
An aircraft is maintaining a 5.2% gradient on a flat terrain. Its height at 7 NM from the runway is approximately:
G/S=240 knots, distance to go=500 NM. What is time to go?
Course 040°(T), TAS 120 kt, wind speed =30 knots. From which direction will the wind give the greatest drift?
X 30 NM Y 20 NM Z ATA X is 1420. ETA Y is 1447. ATA Y is 1450. What is new ETA Z?
Heading is 156°(T), TAS is 320 knots, W/V 130/45. What is your true track?

You are flying at a True Mach No. of .72 in a SAT of -45°C. At 1000 hours you are 100 NM from the CPT DME and your ETA at CPT is 1012. ATC ask you to slow down to be at CPT at 1016. What should your new Mach No be if you reduce speed at 100 NM to go?
Track =090°(T), TAS=460 knots, W/V=360°(T)/100, Variation =10°E, Deviation =-2 What is compass heading and ground speed?
You leave A to fly to B, 475 NM away, at 1000 hours. Your ETA at B is 1130. At 1040, you are 190 NM from A. What ground speed is required to arrive on time at B?
The wind velocity is 359/25. An aircraft is heading 180°(T) at a TAS of 198 knots. (All directions are True). What is its track and ground speed?
An aircraft is climbing at a constant CAS in ISA conditions. What will be the effect on TAS and Mach No.?
options: TAS increases and Mach No. decreases
TAS decreases and Mach No. increases

questions.question: Convert 70 metres/sec into knots.
Airfield elevation is 1000 feet. The QNH is 988. Use 27 feet per hectopascal. What is pressure altitude?

You are flying from A to B, planned track 245°(M), distance 225 NM. Your ground speed is 180 knots. After 15 minutes flying, you fix your position as 3 NM left of planned track. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: You should turn 5 right to go direct to B
You should turn 8 right to go direct to B
questions.solution: You should turn 5 right to go direct to B

questions.question: A pilot receives the following signals from a VOR DME station. Radial=180° ±1° distance =200 NM What is the approximate maximum error?

An aircraft has planned to fly from A to B a total distance of 135 NM. After flying 45 NM the aircraft is 3 NM left of the planned track. Using the 1 in 60 Rule, what would be the alteration of heading to flying directly to B?
By what amount must you change your rate of descent given a 10 knot increase in headwind on a 3° glide slope?

You are on an ILS 3-degree glide slope which passes over the runway threshold at 50 feet. Your DME range is 25 NM from the threshold. What is your height above the runway threshold elevation? (Use the 1 in 60 rule and 6000 feet =1 nautical mile).
An aircraft flies directly from 56N 020W to 56N 030W. The initial Great Circle track from 020W is:
An aircraft starts at position 0410S 17822W and tracks true north for 2950 NM, then turns 90 degrees left, and maintains a rhumb line track for 314 kilometres. What is the final position?
On a chart, 49 nautical miles is represented by 7.0 centimetres. What is the scale?
On a particular direct Mercator wall chart, the 180W to 180E parallel of latitude at 53N is 133 cm long. What is the scale of the chart at 30S?

Which of the following differences in latitude will give the biggest difference in the initial great circle track and the mean great circle track between 2 points separated by 10° change of longitude?
On a chart, meridians at 43N are shown every 10 degrees apart. This is shown on the chart by a distance of 14 cm. What is the approximate scale?
A non-perspective chart:
options: is produced directly from a light projection of a Reduced Earth
is produced by mathematically adjusting a light projection of the Reduced Earth
is used for a polar stereographic projection
questions.solution: is produced by mathematically adjusting a light projection of the Reduced Earth

questions.question: On a Mercator chart, a rhumb line appears as a:
options: small circle concave to the nearer pole
curve convex to the nearer pole

questions.question: Mercator charts use projections.
How does scale change on a normal Mercator chart?
options: expands directly with the secant of the latitude
correct on the standard parallels, expands outside them, contracts within them
expands as the secant of the E/W great circle distance
questions.solution: expands directly with the secant of the latitude
